neurological.resources:

neurological.delLabel1: • Person has 3 or more risk factors: Initiate CAM screening everying 12 hours and intitate PRISME.
neurological.delLabel2: • Person has less than 3 risk factors: DO NOT intiate CAM but continue to monitor for changes in risk factors and initiate as appropriate PRISME.
neurological.delLabel3: See CAM assessments as per BC Guidlines.ca Delirium Screening and Assessment Tools – CAM & PRISME

medLabChemistry.name: Name
medLabChemistry.label55-11: Answer the following questions by selecting one of the options:
medLabChemistry.label55-12: 1. Are all QC* and calibrators (if applicable) within acceptable limits? *refer to Levey-Jennings Chart if available
medLabChemistry.label55-13: 2.  If an assay was performed in duplicate* are all duplicates within acceptable limits? *repeats and dilutions are not considered duplicates
medLabChemistry.label55-14: 3. Are results plausible or physiologically possible based on post-analytical checks?
medLabChemistry.label55-15: Can all patient results be reported?
medLabChemistry.label55-16: If any questions in this section are answered NO or any results are PENDING, complete the following tables:
medLabChemistry.label55-17: Quality Control Troubleshooting Table (*SE=Systematic error, RE=Random error)
medLabChemistry.label55-23: this chemistry form is a work in progress and other tables are planned to be placed here
